text: So I pulled a promo Elenda at the prerelease, im really excited to try her out in Edgar today.
Great pull!
Were you able to play her?
No, I went black red pirates. The deck was super good and fast, the pirate lord is NUTS
The 2/1 first strike rare red pirate that lets you cast a spell on an opponents graveyard was super blah though
Really? It’s not flashy, but it’s still a good limited card.
Yea, the first strike was nice especially against the other aggressive decks, but the ability never mattered.
Hard to matter in Limited I suspect.
Not many worthwhile spells being cast.

It’s just a value card
2-Power first strike for 2 is great early for limited. And later on you can take removal or a combat trick.
Yea, it's probably much better for constructed. I'm really torn on if it's going to connect much though, if there is a spell worth casting I imagine there will be some priority towards blocking it
What do you mean priority for blocking it?
People will block it instead of other creatures to make sure you don't get to cast one of their good spells
It’s an ETB
If the daredevil had flash it could change the face of modern.
Oh shit. Never mind then. I thought it was combat damage trigger
I'm dumb
I'll be in my corner if you need me
Lol, it’s all good. I thought I had missed something.
I’m still reeling from that nut draw you had last night <@U3QMCLQQG>
Yeah you are.
that was a straight beating
you went from
defeated to
stomp town
So much crushing.
I’m about to play my first 2HG, so this is going to be interesting.
the most effective strat is to have an “active” player who has all threats and a “reactive” player who has answers for everything for 2hg
Awesome, thanks for the tip. My friend is better than I am at Limited, so we’ll see how this goes
Hoping for bombs as we all do.
note, this doesn’t mean play a non-interactive deck, just that if you can, put all your creature bombs in one deck if you can
so, open well
Gotcha. Thanks!
Promo Azor

Ok, games today. Last game was Sheriff and I was the Deputy. The Breya player was after me in the turn Order and had Time Sieve out. I had 10 power in creatures and he was open so I cast Triumph of the Hordes to kill him, but he raised this whole stink about how OP infect is, etc. it was getting tense and the table was feeling uncomfortable so, it was a casual game and we all knew each other so I reversed it and hit him for 10. Naturally his turn came around and he took infinite turns and won. So let that be a lesson to you, folks.
people are the worst
They really are.
My rares. My pool has two chupacabra
run both and do not look back
that’s a two for one on a really good body
Wait...Henry ran Triumph himself?!?
I know my meta...I was playing Zacama and sometimes you need to kill someone before they combo out.
Unless that someone whines like a little bitch...
*sniff* I'm so proud
We have three [[!Tomb Robber]] also.
Also, next time he pulls that kind of crap kick him in the tenders
Now THAT is a silly card...
Don't worry...there will be No Mercy next time.
Oh...no, my mistake. Tomb Raider is an ok card...thought it was the one that gives you treasure when one of your creatures dies.
I get not liking Triumph bit to birch about it killing you before you ez mode Breya combo?
Yup...everyone else at the table was giving me the sidelong sympathetic eye while he goldfished.
I GOT TO PLAY REAL COMMANDER FOR THE FIRST TIME SINCE THE ONE DUDE IONA'D/ARMAGGEDON'D ME!
All the while he was saying "I know don't know if my deck can win though..."
Yea, that's when I would have been less than pleasant and verbally mocked him for an undetermined amount of time
Oh, the guy who bitches also plays Iona in his Kaliaa deck...and Iona's my son a previous game.
It wasn't worth it. I pointed out the irony, but calmly. He just huffed.
That's kinda douche-y
It's always worth it to shame the combo player when they act 4
(For the record, Edgar is still a loser. Hasn't won a game because he can't close out 4v1 arch enemy games fast enough(

He runs the facebook group for our LGS's EDH group and said he was going to send out a survey to get folks to agree on how much infect damage should be in our group. Normally I'd be more open to the concept of change, but naturally he lost my vote.
You either get to play degenerate stuff, or you play battlecruiser, you don't get both
<@U6YMA7NAV> if you're on board, you can have Blood Artist/Cutthroat  out with Pitiless Plunderer and [[Summoning Station]] you can kill everyone at the table...

text: Each treasure dies when it comes in, thus creating another treasure which dies, etc.
I could run that in Mishra...

I never understood why mishra was a good commander, then I played against a good mishra deck. 

"Ohhhhhhhhh now I get it"
Yeah...a proper mishra deck is difficult to deal with.
I have one I've been tinkering with for awhile, but was never satisfied with the build.
It's like a really annoying but insanely satisfying puzzle.
Yes...it's fun to have folks counter your stuff and you're perfectly happy about it.
2HG, were playing UW removal and BG slightly less removal
The removal is white is a little insane
The creatures in white are bad

Yup. We have a LOT of removal. James has like... 11 pieces? I have like 7
It’ll be a fun time
Winning is probably evasive beats and hope to draw Azor.
Yeah. For the most part white got the shaft.
Does anyone think [[!Boneyard Parley]] is good? I think it's a pretty cool effect, but I'm not sure if the 7 CMC makes it not worth
If you're in a mill deck, maybe...but 7 is a pretty tough sell.
If you got all 5, then yes.
MAYBE in like... A Tasigur deck?
I don't know...you're not far off Rise of the Dark Realms, so...
It's a fun idea, and if it cost 5, then yes.
But 7?
True

Team “What Are Tribes Anyways?” Went 3-1!
Our third game may have been my favorite win all time

We managed to come back down 16-35 life, and we won on our last possible turn (due to time.) It was also one of the few moments where I actually made critical decisions as a team member that paid off.
Congratulations
Were you on aggro or control?
We were Removal.dec and SlightlyLessRemoval.dec. My teammate played UW hard control and I played GB Removal/Explore
Nasty
Yup. James played 11 Removal spells and I had 7. I had two Chupacabras

That third game was the only game we got to land Azor, and we managed to pull it out. The first attack trigger was my “moment.”
My teammate went to draw cards and was going to pour all the mana into it, and I got him to hold off (basically draw 7 vs. 5) and we drew a spell to help save Azor and had the mana to cast it.
Welp, I expect nothing from my prize packs/prerelease kit for the next two sets
Not a bad haul
